intro: Daphnidostaphylis pungens, commonly known as the spiked daphnidostaphylis, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are usually opposite and have a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
